title: Biden to Nominate Meg Whitman to Be U.S. Ambassador to Kenya; Tech veteran was Republican nominee for California governor in 2010
text:
Ms. Whitman, a member of the boards of Procter & Gamble Co. and General Motors Co., served as a high-profile Republican voice during the 2020 Democratic National Convention. During the mostly virtual convention, she endorsed Mr. Biden, saying he would "strengthen our economy for working people and small-business owners." Ms. Whitman also supported Democratic presidential nominee Hillary Clinton in 2016.

The U.S. has pointed to Kenya, a longtime ally in the war on terror, as a key partner in helping end the civil war in Ethiopia and regional crises in the Horn of Africa. Secretary of State Antony Blinken, in his first official trip to sub-Saharan Africa last month, met Kenyan President Uhuru Kenyatta, who has sought to bridge the divide between Ethiopian Prime Minister Abiy Ahmed and the rebels opposed to the government.

Mr. Biden, who campaigned on being able to work with both parties, has tapped other Republicans to serve in the diplomatic corps.

He nominated former Arizona Sen. Jeff Flake to serve as U.S. ambassador to Turkey along with Cindy McCain, wife of deceased Arizona Republican Sen. John McCain, to be U.S. representative to the United Nations Agencies for Food and Agriculture, a post that carries the rank of ambassador.

Both Mr. Flake and Ms. McCain were confirmed by the Senate in October.

Write to Ken Thomas at ken.thomas@wsj.com

Biden to Nominate Meg Whitman to Be U.S. Ambassador to Kenya
